intro: Silene bassanensis, commonly known as the Bassano's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Italy. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Silene bassanensis is an herbaceous perennial that blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
